thesis.overview: The investment thesis recommends deploying £7.50 million into a portfolio-acquisition strategy focused on diversified pools of senior, short-duration SME credit exposures. The objective is to dilute current leverage, stabilize cash generation, and improve debt service capacity by acquiring high-cash-pay, self-liquidating assets. This strategy includes a dedicated 30% allocation to Life Science SME debt portfolios and 70% to diversified SME credit portfolios, targeting a 7-9% net cash yield.
kpis: Net cash yield: 7–9% at steady state
Collection efficiency: >95% of expected collections (receivables pools)
30+ day delinquency ratio: maintained below agreed pool thresholds (set per asset type)
Annualized net loss rate: <3% core sleeve; <5% Life Science sleeve
Recovery rate on defaults: >75% core sleeve; >70% Life Science sleeve
Concentration: top 10 obligors <15% of any pool; single sector <20% (unless explicitly approved)
Portfolio debt service coverage improvement quarter-on-quarter
Look-through LTV reduction of 5–8 pts over 18–24 months
Principal returned (collections/amortization) as % of invested capital: 25–35% by end of year two (depending on pool mix)
thesis.timeline: 12–18 month investment period (deployment); 18-24 months for look-through LTV reduction and stabilization.
